Legal_Issue: Did the immigration officer err in substituting a negative determination under subsection 76(3) of the Regulations?
Outcome: Application for judicial review dismissed; original decision upheld
Procedural_Context: Judicial review application filed under subsection 72(1)
Evidence_Type: Applicant's language proficiency, additional evidence considered by officer, settlement funds (deemed irrelevant)
Legal_Provision: Subsection 76(3) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Basis_of_Claim: Insufficient English language proficiency affecting economic establishment
Regulation_Cited: Subsection 76(3), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Application_Error: Alleged error in applying subsection 76(3) by substituting negative assessment
Assessment_Standard: Whether officer’s decision was reasonable and supported by evidence
Evidence_Ignored: Settlement funds deemed irrelevant under subsection 76(3)
Application_Factor: Applicant scored 72 points but denied due to language concerns
Decision_Review_Issue: Substitution of negative determination under subsection 76(3)
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Subsection 76(3), Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient English language proficiency raising concerns about economic establishment
Evidentiary_Issues: Relevance of settlement funds; adequacy of language test results
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to officer’s substitution of negative assessment
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations, subsection 76(3)
